Reasoning: **Analyzing card mechanics**

I'm looking into how the Hanging Chad card works. It retriggers when the first played card is scored, but it seems the retrigger effects occur after the initial scoring triggers. So, I need to consider the order, especially between Photograph and Chad. The sequence for scoring involves base chips, card modifiers, 'On scored' Jokers, and then retriggers. It seems like the order impacts the retrigger stage, but initial triggers might not be affected. I'm also noting various independent jokers and their effects.
**Examining joker interactions**

I'm analyzing how independent jokers work, especially how they impact multiplicative and additive values. In Balatro, the order really matters—additive multipliers should come first to maximize final scores. For example, if I start with a hand value of 10, adding +10 before applying a multiplier like x3 gives a better result than the reverse. Gift Card should come before Acrobat to optimize scoring. However, chips added by jokers seem to operate independently, so their order isn’t as significant. I need to keep all these mechanics in mind!
**Rearranging jokers strategically**

To optimize the order of jokers, it seems like placing Photograph first, then Hanging Chad, followed by Stuntman, then Gift Card, and finally Acrobat is the best strategy. Having Gift before Acrobat makes sense, as independent triggers should go from left to right. I’m considering potential consumables too, but Wraith is not useful right now since it sets money to zero. Justice can enhance a card, but I can’t use it in the shop. My best action seems to be to proceed with round selection or reroll the shop for better options.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
